org.tigr.antware.shared.util
Class ExtractArguments

java.lang.Object
  org.tigr.antware.shared.util.ExtractArguments

public class ExtractArguments
extends Object

The class ExtractArguments is used to extract the command line options specified in the args array.

This class supports a subset of the standard unix arguments that include the ability to specify parameters with the '-' and posix style '--' parameters. The class does not yet support the key-value pair options, etc.

Written:

Copyright (C) 2001, The Institute for Genomic Research (TIGR).

All rights reserved.

Author:
Anup Mahurkar

Method Detail

getOptions

public static String[] getOptions(String[] args,
                                  Map options)
                           throws InvalidArgumentException
The getOptions method returns a Map that contains the command line options that match the standard unix command line parameter convention.

This method can presently understand the '-' & the posix style '--' long name options. Multiple values can be specified as either a comma separated list, or as multiple occurences of the param. The parameter forms the key in the hashmap returned, while the value is the value of the param. For multiple occurences of a param the values are returned as a List.

An occurence of the string '--' by itself will stop the parsing. All arguments after that are considered as arguments and not parameters.

Parameters:
args - a String[] array containing the command line options
Returns:
a Map containing the options that meet the unix parameter conventions. Options that are not unix style options are ignored and can be retrieved through other methods. Options that are flags have a value of null.
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException - if an invalid argument format is recognized

getListValue

public static Vector getListValue(Map pOptionsMap,
                                  String pOption)
The method getListValue returns the value(s) for the specified parameter as a list. If the value is a single value, it is added to a new list and the list returned.

Parameters:
pOptionsMap - a Map containing the options where the key is the parameter name and value is the value(s) associated with this key
pOption - a String representing the option name of interest
Returns:
a Vector containing the value(s) as a list if the option exists, null if the option does not exist in the hash.

readFileParameters

public static Map readFileParameters(String iniFileKey,
                                     String section,
                                     Map options)
                              throws InvalidFileFormatException,
                                     FileNotFoundException,
                                     IOException,
                                     DataFormatErrorException
The readFileParameters method reads values for command line parameters from an INI style file and returns the options map with the file parameters added to it.

The INI file name is read from the options hash using the specified key. In the INI file options are read from the specified section name.

If the options hash already has a parameter with the same name as the file, the one from the options hash supersedes the file parameters.

Parameters:
iniFileParamName - a String value representing the parameter in the options has that specifies the INI file name
section - a String value for the section within the INI file that holds the parameters that are to be read
options - a Map containing the command line parameters where the key is the parameter name.
Returns:
a Map containing the parsed command line parameters combined with params read from the INI file.
Throws:
FileNotFoundException - if an error occurs
IOException - if an error occurs
InvalidFileFormatException
DataFormatErrorException

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws InvalidArgumentException
Throws:
InvalidArgumentException
